conclusion: A plate with mass M is moving on a horizontal surface, and a block with mass m is placed on it at t=0 with zero initial velocity.
The block does not leave the plate during motion, and M=2m.
Neither the block and the plate nor the plate and the horizontal surface are smooth.
The relationship between the velocity of the block and time from t=0 is shown in Figure B.
The acceleration due to gravity is g=10 m/s².
The problem asks for the coefficient of kinetic friction μ₁ between the block and the plate.
Figure A shows a block on a plate moving horizontally with velocity v.
